intro: Verbesina baccharifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
